question: Benny and Molly started at 2 on the number line and hopped to 5 to collect some carrots. How many hops did they take?
They spotted more carrots at 7. If they started at 4, how many hops did they take to reach the carrots at 7?
Molly started hopping from 1 and landed at 3, where more carrots were waiting. How many hops did he make?
Benny and Molly both started at 6 and hopped to 9 to grab more carrots. How many hops did they take?
The next batch of carrots was at 5, but they began hopping from 3. How many hops did they take?
Molly started at 10 and jumped to collect some more carrots. Use the number line to complete the number sentence.
Benny started to hop from 45 to collect a batch of carrots.
Both Benny and Molly started at 55. Use the number line to complete the number sentence.
Molly was standing on 60 and hopped to gather more carrots.Use the number line to complete the number sentence.
They noticed more carrots. Benny and Molly started at 20. Use the number line to complete the number sentence.
